security: Revealing the CIA's interest in monitoring the Movimiento Democratica Cristiano and its contacts could compromise intelligence-gathering activities and potentially endanger individuals involved. Specifically, the document states, 'Subject Organisation is of interest to (CA/1) because it forwarded the attached letter...to Bela Kiraly of the Hungarian Freedom Fighters Inc.---a (CA sponsored activity)'. Sharing this information would expose a CA-sponsored activity and the nature of the CIA's interest in anti-Castro groups.
summary: A memorandum outlines the CIA's interest in the Movimiento Democratica Cristiano, an Anti-Castro group, and its connection to Bela Kiraly of the Hungarian Freedom Fighters Inc., a CA-sponsored activity.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, addressed to the files by George Reademan, details the CIA's interest in the Movimiento Democratica Cristiano (MDC) because it sent a letter, prepared by Laureano BATESTI falla, to Bela Kiraly of the Hungarian Freedom Fighters Inc., a CA-sponsored group. James Comion requested data from the Office of Security about the MDC and Laureano BATESTI falla to assess whether Kiraly should meet with a representative of the MDC to determine if Kiraly could assist the group. A review of security records indicated the MDC was an Anti-Castro group and BATESTI falla had been of interest to the Agency under an Operational Approval in 1960.
title: MOVIMIENTO DEMOCRATICA CRISTIANO
